name: Gaslamp Killer x Hit + Run 'Lake of Fire' Mix CD
description: The Lake of Fire CD produced in conjunction with Hit + Run, features Gaslamp Killer's unique musical chicanery, plumbing the depths of your dome with heavy psyche beats, downtempo and dubstep all in equal shares. This bad boy is sold out in most parts, and won't see reproduction as GLK is always on the next. Grab it while you can.

name: Lake of Fire T-Shirt
description: Printed in a limited run by Hit + Run, the Lake of Fire t-shirt has been blowing off shelves since it dropped a few months back. They will sell out.

name: Gaslamp Killer 'My Troubled Mind' EP (Signed and Numbered)
description: After years of secrecy and serious self-analysis, Gaslamp Killer finally drops his debut solo release. I heard a rough cut of what was to be this EP more than a year ago, and I can say that he's really come a long way in short span of time. Still a disciple of dusty cut and paste, GLK has found the sweet spots of all sorts of records, pasted them together into an undulating amoeba of musk, snares, and exotic instruments. For a beats release, this thing really travels in different directions... you get a sense that you're on a journey... maybe through the back alleys of Morocco being chased by hustlers, to a hash den in Islamabad, to the back of that famous record store in Hungary listening to undiscovered beats. The thrill kinda reminds me of listening to MoWax singles back in the day. Seven tracks in all. Signed and numbered edition 2000. Highly recommended.

name: Puta Magazine #1
description: "Every single page in this bastard is fucking great. Like "I want to tear out the pages and frame each one" great. Like "I'll buy two issues so I can get both sides of the page framed" great. Really. So highly recommended." — CrownDozen.com The very first issue of PUTA, formerly out of print, of this very special magazine is available again in small quantities. The LA-based art magazine was conceived to challenge artists with a theme. This time, the theme was "Missing" and featured work from artists as diverse as Von Stropp, Mel Kadel, Yelena Yemchuk, Ro Starr, Neasden Control Centre, James Patterson, Matty Libatique and Kevin Kerslake. Buy it now from a very limited run, truly a collector's item.

name: Puta Magazine #2
description: "Every single page in this bastard is fucking great. Like "I want to tear out the pages and frame each one" great. Like "I'll buy two issues so I can get both sides of the page framed" great. Really. So highly recommended." — CrownDozen.com This second issue, now out of print, of this very special magazine will be available online and print-on-demand soon. This time, artists like Russell from Ssur, Jeremy Yoder, Sage Vaughn and Darren Waterston took on the theme "Soul" which turned out to be a jaw-dropping issue. Definitely already a collector's item.
